issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: Index file created with MapFile.fix for an ordered block-compressed data file does not allow to find values for keys existing in the data file via the MapFile.get method.
fields.summary: MapFile.fix creates a wrong index file in case of block-compressed data file.

comments.body: This patch adds a Unit test for the issue (and its fix) and is ready for review.
The patch is ready for review.
I do not seem to be able to assign the issue to myself. Can you please assign it to me? Thanks.

Can the patch be reviewed, please? Thanks.

Sorry for the delay, [~rybkine]. {{MapFile}} is rarely modified, these days.

I have some concerns about the existing code (catching {{Throwable}} while reconstructing the index?), but the patch and unit test look good. +1
I committed this. Thanks, Grigori
Thank you, [~chris.douglas], very much for reviewing and committing the patch.

Thank you very much for the comment about the existing code, [~chris.douglas]. I am willing to provide a patch. Please, let me know how it would be better to proceed or maybe open a ticket and assign it to me?

Thanks, [~rybkine]. While {{MapFile}} has some odd quirks, it's maintained by the project mostly for compatibility with older applications. Improving the code quality may not be a good use of your time. If you're interested in file formats generally, you may want to check out the ORC and Parquet projects.

Of course, if that impression is mistaken and {{MapFile}} is important to you, please feel free to open JIRAs to improve it (provided it continues to read/write files compatible with the existing format).
